The '''High Pass''', also known as the '''Pass of Imladris'''<ref name="DisasterNote14">{{UT|7a}}, note 14</ref> or '''''Cirith Forn en Andrath'''''<ref name="Gladden">{{UT|Gladden}}, second paragraph</ref>,<ref name="Index">{{UT|Index}}, entry ''* Cirith Forn en Andrath''</ref> was a pass over the [[Misty Mountains]] east of the elven refuge of [[Rivendell]].<ref>{{HM|UI}}, entry ''High Pass'', p. 207</ref> Somewhere close to Rivendell<ref name="Gladden"/> a long, hard and dangerous path climbed into the mountains until it reached the mountain under which laid [[Goblin-town]] on its way to the High Pass.<ref name="Hill">{{H|Hill}}</ref> From the High Pass the ancient [[Old Forest Road]] descended to the [[Vales of Anduin]] to the river [[Anduin]] and then on into [[Mirkwood]] forest.<ref name="DisasterNote14"/><ref>{{FR|Map}}</ref>

There were two passes near Goblin-town: the High Pass and another pass that was easier to travel. The main gate of Goblin-town was located near the easier pass. Because the [[Orcs]] of Goblin-town had often caught travellers who spent the night near the main gate at the easier pass, travellers stopped using this pass and used the High Pass instead. However, the Orcs created a new entrance in a cave near the High Pass.<ref name="Pan">{{H|Pan}}, "But their main gate used to come out on a different pass [...]"</ref>

==History==
In {{SA|3434}}<ref>{{App|SA}}, entry for the year 3434, p. 1084</ref> the main part of the army of [[Gil-galad]] with [[Isildur]] and a part of the army of [[Arnor]] used the High Pass and the [[Redhorn Gate|pass]] of [[Caradhras]]) to cross the Misty Mountains on their march to [[Mordor]] in the War of the [[Last Alliance of Elves and Men]]<ref>{{UT|7a}}, note 20</ref>. After this war [[Isildur]] was slain on his way back from [[Gondor]] to Rivendell at the [[Gladden Fields]] by [[Orcs]] that had been sent there before the [[War of the Last Alliance]] by [[Sauron]] to watch the passes.<ref>{{UT|Gladden}}</ref>

In the [[Third Age]], the High Pass became dangerous again because of the Orcs. Only after the [[War of the Dwarves and Orcs]], which nearly wiped out all of the Orcs of the mountains, did it become safe again. Nevertheless, in {{TA|2940}}, the goblins of [[Goblin-town]] had burrowed their way back to it, and [[Bilbo Baggins]] and the Dwarves of [[Thorin]] were captured there the next year during the [[Quest of Erebor]].<ref name="Hill" />

During the [[War of the Ring]], [[Grimbeorn|Grimbeorn the Old]] and the [[Beornings]] kept the High Pass open,<ref>{{FR|Meetings}}, p. 228</ref> but the [[Fellowship of the Ring]] ignored the High Pass because the eastern side of the Misty Mountains had become too dangerous.

==Other names==
The High Pass was also known as the '''''Pass of Imladris'''''.<ref name="Index"/>

In [[Sindarin]],<ref name="Eldamo">{{webcite|author=Paul Strack|articleurl=https://www.eldamo.org/content/words/word-1075852477.html|articlename=S. ''Cirith Forn en Andrath'' loc.|website=Eldamo|accessed=28 June 2023}}</ref> the pass was called '''''Cirith Forn en Andrath''''' ("The High-climbing Pass of the North").<ref name="Index" /> Paul Strack suggests that the name is a combination of ''[[cirith]]'' ("pass"), ''[[forod|forn]]'' ("north"), ''[[en]]'' ("of the") and ''[[andrath#Etymology|andrath]]'' ("long climb").<ref name="Eldamo" />

==Other versions of the legendarium==
The translation of ''Cirith Forn en Andrath'' as "the high-climbing pass of the north" seems to be either a loose gloss or even an error, since elsewhere in ''[[Unfinished Tales]]'' ''andrath'' is definitively translated as "long climb",<ref>{{UT|7a}}, note 4, p. 278</ref> and ''an(d)'' is definitively stated to mean "long".<ref>{{S|Appendix}}, entry ''an(d)''</ref>

In the draft for the chapter, "[[The Ring Goes South]]", [[Elrond]] gave a name for both the High Pass and the [[Front Porch|Goblin Gate]], which was ''Annerchin''.<ref>{{RS|Ring}}, pp. 416, 432</ref>

==Portrayals in Adaptations==
[[File:The Lord of the Rings Online - High Pass.jpg|thumb|250px|left|The High Pass in ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'']]
'''2007: ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'':'''
:The High Pass can be found in the region of the Misty Mountains and is divided into two areas: the Northern High Pass and the Southern High Pass. The mountain pass to the [[Vales of Anduin]] to the east was reopened by the [[Beornings]] following the [[War of the Ring]].

'''2012: ''[[The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey]]'':'''
:The Dwarves take the High Pass, but without Gandalf. They end up in the middle of a fight between [[Stone-giants]].
